$description: Core sizing primitives for shared component dimensions. These tokens define standard heights and widths used across multiple components, ensuring visual consistency. Component-specific dimensions live in their respective component token files.

controlHeight.$description: Standard heights for interactive controls (buttons, inputs, selects). Shared scale ensures form elements align vertically.

lg.$description: Large control height (48px). Use for: prominent controls, touch-optimized UIs.

md.$description: Medium control height (42px). DEFAULT size for most controls.

sm.$description: Small control height (36px). Use for: secondary controls, compact layouts.

xl.$description: Extra large control height (60px). Use for: marketing forms, high-emphasis controls.

xs.$description: Extra small control height (30px). Use for: compact forms, inline actions, space-constrained UIs.

icon.$description: Standard sizes for icon elements. Use these to ensure icons are appropriately sized relative to text and other elements.

lg.$description: Large icon size (24px). Use for: prominent icons, action icons, toolbar icons.

md.$description: Medium icon size (20px). DEFAULT for most icons. Use for: standalone icons, navigation icons.

sm.$description: Small icon size (16px). Use for: inline icons, button icons with text, input icons.

xl.$description: Extra large icon size (32px). Use for: feature icons, empty state illustrations, marketing icons.

xs.$description: Extra small icon size (12px). Use for: inline indicators, badge icons, compact UIs.
